description: From French gynécologie, from Ancient Greek γυνή (gunḗ, “woman”) + -logie (“-logy”). Replaced earlier gyniatrics.

nouns.description: gynecology (usually uncountable, plural gynecologies) (American spelling) (Canadian spelling, more common)

entries.meaning: The study of, or the branch of medicine specializing in, the medical problems of women, especially disorders of the reproductive organs.
